conversation.content:
Hi Mark! Thanks for taking time to share your thoughts about AI in teaching.

This is a hybrid survey - I'll ask you questions one at a time, and when your answers indicate complexity or high interest, I'll ask follow-up questions to understand better.

The survey has 6 sections and typically takes 10-30 minutes depending on how much detail you want to provide. You're in control - you can keep responses brief or elaborate as much as you'd like.

Let's start with your current experience with AI tools.

Which AI tools have you tried? (List any, or say 'none yet')
none yet

Welcome to the St. Cloud State University Faculty AI Adoption Survey! This will help us understand how faculty are currently using AI and what support would be most helpful.

Let's start with your current AI experience.

How often do you currently use AI tools in any capacity (teaching, research, or personal use)?

Options: Never, Rarely, Monthly, Weekly, Daily
I've never used AI outside of this survey

That's helpful to know - you're starting fresh with AI tools.

What is your primary reason for not having used AI tools yet?

Options: Not aware of available tools, Lack of training/knowledge, Privacy/security concerns, Don't see the value, Haven't had time to explore, Other reason
No time, and not knowing where to start

That makes a lot of sense - those are really common barriers. It can feel overwhelming when there are so many tools out there.

Now let's look at your potential interest in AI for teaching.

How interested are you in using AI tools to assist with creating course materials (like syllabi, assignments, or handouts)?

Please rate from 1-5, where 1 = Not at all interested and 5 = Very interested

Got it - moderate interest in using AI for course materials.

How interested are you in using AI tools to help with grading or providing feedback to students?

Please rate from 1-5, where 1 = Not at all interested and 5 = Very interested

How interested are you in using AI tools to help with lesson planning or curriculum development?

Please rate from 1-5, where 1 = Not at all interested and 5 = Very interested

How interested are you in using AI tools for research activities (literature reviews, data analysis, writing assistance)?

Please rate from 1-5, where 1 = Not at all interested and 5 = Very interested

Thanks! Now let's look at potential concerns and barriers.

How concerned are you about student academic integrity if AI tools become more prevalent in education?

Please rate from 1-5, where 1 = Not at all concerned and 5 = Very concerned
You mentioned you're quite concerned about academic integrity with AI tools becoming more prevalent. What specific aspects of academic integrity worry you most?
students using it to cheat

That's a very legitimate concern that many faculty share - the worry about students using AI to complete assignments dishonestly.

How confident do you feel in your ability to detect when students have used AI inappropriately in their work?

Please rate from 1-5, where 1 = Not at all confident and 5 = Very confident

How concerned are you about the privacy and security of student data when using AI tools?

Please rate from 1-5, where 1 = Not at all concerned and 5 = Very concerned

How concerned are you about the time it would take to learn new AI tools?

Please rate from 1-5, where 1 = Not at all concerned and 5 = Very concerned

How concerned are you about the accuracy or reliability of AI-generated content?

Please rate from 1-5, where 1 = Not at all concerned and 5 = Very concerned

Thanks! Now let's explore what kind of support would be most helpful for you.

What type of training or support would be most valuable to help you get started with AI tools?

Options: One-on-one consultation, Group workshops, Online tutorials, Written guides/documentation, Hands-on practice sessions, Other
Online tutorials would be great

That's great to know - online tutorials would work well for your schedule and let you learn at your own pace.

How much time would you realistically be willing to invest in learning about AI tools initially?

Options: Less than 1 hour, 1-3 hours, 4-6 hours, 7-10 hours, More than 10 hours
a few hours a week is all I can manage

That sounds very reasonable - a few hours a week would actually add up to good progress over time.

What specific topics would you most want covered in AI training for faculty?

Options: Basic AI tool overview, Academic integrity policies, Privacy and data security, Practical classroom applications, Tool-specific training, Other
I need to start with the basics

Perfect - starting with the basics makes complete sense given you're new to AI tools.

Now let's talk about NextEd services. NextEd is our campus support service that helps faculty integrate educational technology.

Are you currently familiar with NextEd services at St. Cloud State?

Options: Very familiar, Somewhat familiar, Have heard of it, Not familiar at all
I only heard of it the other day.

That's totally fine - NextEd is still building awareness across campus.

Would you be interested in NextEd providing AI-related support and training for faculty?

Options: Very interested, Somewhat interested, Neutral, Not very interested, Not at all interested
Very interested

That's wonderful to hear! It sounds like NextEd could be a great resource for you.

What would be the most convenient way for you to access AI training and support from NextEd?

Options: In-person sessions, Online/virtual sessions, Self-paced online modules, Email support, Drop-in help sessions, Other
Drop-in sessions would be really handy

That's a great suggestion - drop-in sessions would give you the flexibility to get help when you need it without having to commit to scheduled times.

Finally, let's gather some background information to help us better understand our faculty needs.

What is your primary department or college?
I work in sociology

Great! Sociology brings such an interesting perspective to AI applications.

How many years have you been teaching at the university level?

Options: Less than 2 years, 2-5 years, 6-10 years, 11-20 years, More than 20 years
more than 20 years

That's wonderful - you bring a lot of teaching experience to this conversation.

What is your current position?

Options: Lecturer, Assistant Professor, Associate Professor, Full Professor, Adjunct Faculty, Other
I'm a full professor

Perfect! I think I have everything I need. Let me generate a summary of your responses...

## Survey Response Summary

**Respondent Profile:**
- Full Professor, Sociology Department
- 20+ years university teaching experience

**Current AI Usage:**
- Never used AI tools outside of this survey
- Primary barriers: Lack of time and not knowing where to start

**Interest Levels (1-5 scale):**
- Course materials creation: 3 (moderate)
- Grading/feedback assistance: 3 (moderate)  
- Lesson planning/curriculum: 3 (moderate)
- Research activities: 2 (low)

**Concerns (1-5 scale):**
- Academic integrity: 4 (high concern) - specifically worried about students using AI to cheat
- Confidence detecting AI misuse: 1 (very low confidence)
- Privacy/security of student data: 4 (high concern)
- Time to learn new tools: 4 (high concern)
- AI content accuracy: 3 (moderate concern)

**Support Preferences:**
- Training format: Online tutorials
- Time commitment: A few hours per week
- Content focus: Basic AI tool overview
- Access method: Drop-in help sessions

**NextEd Services:**
- Awareness: Just heard of it recently
- Interest in AI support: Very interested

Does this accurately capture your responses? Anything to add or clarify?
